page.title: 03WILDLIFE OF WOOKEY HOLE AREA
page.content: THERE IS A LOT OF WILDLIFE IN WOOKEY HOLE AND LOTS OF PEOPLE COME TO SEE BIRDS NESTING AND BUMBLE BEES HOVERING OVER FLOWERS.THE COUNTRY SIDE HAS MANY DIFFERENT ANIMALS TOO,SUCH AS RABBITS, SQUIRRELS AND BADGERS.GREY SQUIRRELS ARE MOST COMMON ALTHOUGH YOU MAY SEE A RED SQUIRREL. IF YOU GO FOR WALKS IN THE COUNTRYSIDE YOU ARE LIKELY TO SEE BUZZARDS, SPARROWHAWKS OR KESTRELS WAITING TO SWOOP DOWN ON THEIR PREY. ABOUT A MILE FROM WOOKEY HOLE VILLAGE IS EBBOR GORGE NATURE RESERVE WHICH IS VERY GOOD FOR BIRD WATCHING, VIEWS OVER WELLS AND EASTON, AND TO HAVE A PICNIC.IN THE SPRING, PRIMROSES ARE PLENTIFUL AND VIOLETS GROW IN THE VEGETATION. FOR THOSE WHO ENJOY IT, THERE ARE STEEP SLOPES AND ROCKS TO CLIMB.
